Transition Age Youth

Transitional age youth is an important population segment for VR agencies. The chart below illustrates the average rehabilitation rate for transition age youth in each RSA disability category.

Rehabilitation rates are displayed for the following disability categories:

  • Visual
  • Hearing
  • Orthopedic
  • Intellectual
  • Substance Abuse
  • Mental Health
  • Learning
  • Traumatic Brain Injury
  • Other

Clicking on the legend will allow you to manipulate the chart to only see data relevant to your needs or interests.

Rehabilitation Rate of Transition Age Youth by Disability Category

Powered by Socrata

Sources: The 2011 National Survey of State Vocational Rehabilitation Agencies; RSA-911 FY2010

© ExploreVR.org — ExploreVR is part of the Vocational Rehabilitation Research and Training Center (VR-RRTC). The VR-RRTC is a national center that builds the capacity of the public vocational rehabilitation (VR) program to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities. The VR-RRTC is funded by the National Institute on Disability and Rehabilitation Research and the Rehabilitation Services Administration of the US Department of Education. Visit the VR-RRTC website (www.vr-rrtc.org) for more information about the centerâ€™s policy research, training, and technical assistance efforts.
